Gullfoss.name: Gullfoss
Gullfoss.description: The Golden Falls - Iceland's most famous two-tiered waterfall with thunderous power and rainbows on sunny days.
tips: Best photos from upper viewing platform
Wear waterproof clothing - gets very misty
Visit during golden hour for magical lighting
cons: Can get extremely misty and wet

alternatives.name: Háifoss
alternatives.description: Iceland's fourth highest waterfall at 122m, much less crowded with spectacular highland views.

alternatives.name: Aldeyjarfoss
alternatives.description: Stunning waterfall surrounded by unique basalt columns, creating a dramatic amphitheater effect.

local_insights: Visit early morning (before 9 AM) to avoid tour buses
The lower viewpoint gets you closer but much wetter
Local photographers recommend sunset for golden light on the water

Geysir.name: Geysir
Geysir.description: Historic geothermal area with Strokkur geyser erupting every 5-10 minutes up to 20 meters high.
tips: Strokkur is more active than the original Geysir
Stand upwind to avoid sulfur smell
Wait for multiple eruptions for best photos
pros: Part of classic Golden Circle route
cons: Limited viewing angles due to crowds

alternatives.name: Hverir Geothermal Area
alternatives.description: Dramatic lunar-like landscape with boiling mud pools, steaming vents, and colorful mineral deposits near Lake Mývatn.

alternatives.name: Gunnuhver Hot Springs
alternatives.description: Powerful geothermal area on Reykjanes Peninsula with massive steam vents and colorful mineral formations.

local_insights: The original Geysir rarely erupts now - focus on Strokkur
Best photos from the hill behind the main viewing area
Visitor center has good coffee but overpriced meals

Bruarfoss.name: Bruarfoss
Bruarfoss.description: Hidden gem waterfall with stunning blue water cascading over dark rocks. Requires short hike to reach.
tips: Most beautiful waterfall in Iceland according to many
pros: Less crowded than main Golden Circle stops

alternatives.name: Faxi Waterfall
alternatives.description: Charming smaller waterfall with salmon ladder, easily accessible and perfect for a peaceful stop.

alternatives.name: Gljufrabui (Hidden Waterfall)
alternatives.description: Secret waterfall hidden behind Seljalandsfoss, accessible through a narrow canyon entrance.

local_insights: The hike is easy but wear waterproof shoes
Best light for photos is mid-morning

Kerið.name: Kerið Crater
Kerið.description: Volcanic crater lake with striking red and orange crater walls surrounding a deep blue-green lake.
tips: Walk around the rim for different viewpoints
Beautiful at sunset with golden lighting

Reykjadalur.name: Reykjadalur Hot Springs
Reykjadalur.description: Natural geothermal river where you can bathe in warm waters after a scenic 3km hike through steaming valley.
tips: Water temperature varies along the river

Landmannalaugar.name: Landmannalaugar
Landmannalaugar.description: Stunning highland destination famous for colorful rhyolite mountains, natural hot springs, and dramatic landscapes.

Jökulsárlón.name: Jökulsárlón
Jökulsárlón.description: Spectacular glacier lagoon filled with floating icebergs calving from Breiðamerkurjökull glacier.
tips: Boat tours available for closer iceberg experience
Best light for photography in early morning/evening
cons: Tour buses dominate best viewing spots

alternatives.name: Fjallsárlón
alternatives.description: Jökulsárlón's 'little sister' - smaller glacier lagoon with equally stunning icebergs and much fewer crowds.

alternatives.name: Sólheimajökull Glacier
alternatives.description: Accessible glacier outlet where you can walk right up to the ice and see glacier formations up close.

local_insights: Arrive early morning to avoid tour buses
The lagoon is deepest glacier lagoon in Iceland
Zodiac boat tours get closer to icebergs than larger boats

Diamond Beach.name: Diamond Beach
Diamond Beach.description: Black volcanic sand beach where crystal-clear icebergs from Jökulsárlón wash ashore like scattered diamonds.
tips: Never turn your back on the waves

Svartifoss.name: Svartifoss
Svartifoss.description: Unique waterfall surrounded by dark basalt columns that inspired Reykjavik's Hallgrímskirkja church design.
tips: Well-marked trail but can be icy

Kirkjufellsfoss.name: Kirkjufellsfoss
Kirkjufellsfoss.description: Picturesque waterfall with iconic Kirkjufell mountain backdrop - one of the most photographed locations in Iceland.

Dettifoss.name: Dettifoss
Dettifoss.description: Europe's most powerful waterfall by volume, with 500 cubic meters of water per second thundering over 45m cliff.
tips: Accessible from both east and west sides
West side (862) has better views but rougher road
Extremely loud - you'll feel the power

Blue Lagoon.name: Blue Lagoon
Blue Lagoon.description: Famous geothermal spa with milky blue waters rich in silica and minerals, offering luxury wellness experience.

alternatives.name: Reykjadalur Hot Springs
alternatives.description: Natural geothermal river where you can bathe for free after a scenic 3km hike through steaming valleys.

alternatives.name: Mývatn Nature Baths
alternatives.description: Less crowded geothermal baths in North Iceland with views of volcanic landscapes and Lake Mývatn.
alternatives.drive_time: Part of northern Ring Road itinerary

alternatives.name: Seljavallalaug Pool
alternatives.description: Historic outdoor geothermal pool built in 1923, hidden between mountains with authentic Icelandic bathing culture.

local_insights: Locals prefer the natural hot springs over Blue Lagoon
Book the cheapest package - extras aren't worth it
Better to visit on departure day if doing Ring Road
